title: Question about getting S-, S or S+
body: I don't like using one off stories for questioning but this is an exception. Yesterday I played a game as {{champion:421}} and went 17/2/14 in top lane. I got an S- and was pretty proud of myself however I'm currently Rank 6 with {{champion:421}} so I was a bit frustrated that I only got S- (because I need S or above). Today though, I went top lane again with {{champion:421}} and went 9/2/8 and got an S. If I went better in my previous game, how come I wasn't ranked as high as the game today? If anyone knows anything, some explanation would be great.

replies.body:
This article by Telecasterdude is pretty informative about Champion Mastery. If you have any questions, don't hesitate to ask!

http://kb.leaguevolunteers.com/gameplay:champion_mastery

Thanks Wuks, it says here that: _Grades are calculated based on role and champion. Furthermore, a series of performance metrics are used to compare a player's performance to others, on that same champion and role. Only performances in the top percentage of players, for each champion in a specific role, are awarded S class grades_. This doesn't seem to make sense though considering I went better in my previous game and received a lower rank compared to today's game. Is there something I'm missing?

So essentially, it takes the averages of the champion in that role. It seems that Rek'Sai players perform better in the jungle, so the score needed there to get a good grade needs to be higher. Fewer people play Rek'Sai top and don't perform as well, so the score needed there is lower. 

Hope that answers your question!
Hypothetically, if you played Zed/Fizz/Katarina etc as a support, would virtually any score get an S then? as almost no one would be playing Zed etc as a support?

It's graded on a bell curve, so it wouldn't be virtually any score, but hypothetically any decent score would net you an S since they are rarely played/played well. 

I think you'll find Zed might be the exception to that though. It's embarrassing how badly I've had my lane destroyed by a Zed "support" because my ADC and I lack mobility. He's a very cheese support, if you're a good Zed and can get that successful jungle gank early against a low mobility lane it's near impossible to lose the lane.

Of course I've seen the really bad Zed supports as well, but he's one of those "supports" that pretty much go one way or the other, they do really well or really really badly. Which unfortunately means the top percent scores are pretty high.

Basically in my books, you need an ability that can actually 'Support' before you qualify as a support. as far as I'm aware, All Zeds abilities help himself and no one else (admittedly he does have a minor slow, but find me a champ that doesn't.)

it hardly seems fair though, Zed mains who are too shit to get an S mid lane end up polluting bot lane just to get an easy one

Well I won't get into how much I hate champs like Zed and Yasuo :P that's a slippery slope. But I generally agree with your definition of what can be classified as support. 

I enjoy playing off supports, and I would even consider champions like Vel'Koz/Zyra 'real' supports (as in I'd play them in ranked) but it depends how you are building them. Obvs if you're building Rab's/Luden's first you aren't being a good support. Sightstone > Spookies > Rylai's would ususally be my direction with them.

Champs like Liss/Sejuani/Anivia/Teemo can technically support they just aren't all that effective unless you're god tier with them :P

Champs like Lee Sin/Xin Zhao/Zed/Yasuo/Kat etc do not in my mind count as supports by any stretch of the definition, even if most of them do have some form of hard cc.
Zed is cancer, go see a doctor!
No he's not. Riot ruined zed, but he's not undeniably cancerous with no counterplay whatsoever

lol, press R jump straight to the enemy carry (while untargetable), do all the damage you want, when things start to go bad for you, press R again to remove yourself completely from the fight back to a safe distance, its not like you need to wait for your ult or anything, nah that just goes off by itself.

So short of hard CCing him for all 6 seconds, there is no way to stop him teleporting back to safety. Im pretty sure an ADC's main counterplay for Zed was buying QSS, but guess what riot changed that item with the sole intent of buffing Zed.

Theres a reason he has a 50%+ ban rate (which is more than all other champs except 1), and its not because 'riot ruined him'

I'm with you about Zed and Yas (i used to be a has main until azir came out, and now even i cant stand the sight of him)

I agree that off meta supports can be fun, often it is dependant on the ADC too, I've had a fair bit of success playing Anivia supp with Ashe ADC, because the permastun/permaslow is broken, but i wouldn't play it in ranked, and i doubt it would be as effective with any other ADC. 


But yea, I've had my fair share of Katarina and Xin supports, not fun.

I had to play Rengar "support" the other day because this guy didn't understand role-calling in normals (he thought if 2 people called a role, they both get it, in my case it was jungle). I was with friends bot and top. Anyway, I only got about 9 kills and 3 deaths, with less than 80 cs at 20 minutes when enemy surrendered, and got an S.

So I guess it takes into account where you're playing.

Ahaha aye it does. Champ + position + gamemode is the scores it rates you against, I imagine getting and S with Rengar supp wouldn't be all that difficult :P but 9/3 in a beyond unideal situation is admirable, and good on you for just going with it.

There's a whole lotta other factors involved, not just straight KDA.

A shorter game would require a lower score.
Kill participation seems to be more relevant than flat KDA is in my experience.
CS and wards placed also seem to be relevant factors.
Objective kills/assists are also significant.

It is a pretty big score difference I'll give you that, but there are a whole lotta things there that might have meant the difference. In fact I think your situation makes a pretty good case for how little straight KDA can matter to a mastery grade.
Okay that makes a lot more sense. Thanks for the reply :D.
well i got S- on master yi {{champion:11}} and found that jungling made my score higher than just going down one lane

I believe your farm plays a big part in it.

163CS in 24 minutes is a fair way better than 210CS in 40.
